articles.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Sunday's opponents and title rivals Manchester City have "raised the bar to levels not seen before".
articles.title: Man City level 'not seen before in football' - Arteta

articles.description: Kristoffer Ajer scores in the ninth minute of injury time as Brentford snatch a draw against Manchester United in an incredible finish.
articles.title: Brentford's Ajer scores late goal to deny Man Utd

articles.description: England score eight tries to hammer Wales at Ashton Gate in front of a record crowd of 19,705 for a Red Roses game outside of Twickenham.
articles.title: England hammer Wales in front of record crowd

articles.description: Aston Villa maintain their three-point lead over Tottenham in the race for Champions League football with a win over Wolves at Villa Park.
articles.title: Villa beat Wolves to maintain top-four gap over Spurs

articles.description: Bayer Leverkusen avoid their first defeat of the season with late goals from Robert Andrich and Patrik Schick securing a 2-1 victory over Hoffenheim.
articles.title: Leverkusen produce late comeback against Hoffenheim

articles.description: Sevilla say left-back Marcos Acuna and the club's coaching staff were the targets of "racist and xenophobic abuse" during Saturday's La Liga win at Getafe.
articles.title: Sevilla condemn racist abuse of Acuna

articles.description: Everton equal a club record with a 12th consecutive Premier League game without a win as Seamus Coleman's late own goal hands the points to Bournemouth.
articles.title: Coleman own goal as Everton match winless club record

articles.description: Rangers return to the summit of the Scottish Premiership for the moment as they pick off Hibernian at Ibrox.
articles.title: Rangers return to summit with victory over Hibs

articles.description: Harlequins survive a huge scare to beat Bath at Twickenham Stoop after the visitors fight back from 37 points down.
articles.title: Harlequins survive superb Bath fightback in thriller

articles.description: American Danielle Collins beats fourth seed Elena Rybakina in straight sets to win the Miami Open - the first WTA 1,000 title of her career.
articles.title: Miami Open: Danielle Collins beats Elena Rybakina in women's final
